title: Aen 1 340-342 - SS sight - line 1 - Gram - tense

content.description:
An Introduction to the Queen

Imperium Dido TyriaTyrius, -a, -um, adj.: Carthaginian regit urbe profecta,
germanumgermanus, -i, m. = frater, -tris fugiens. Longa est iniuria, longae 
fabulae; sed summa sequarsequor, -i: to summarize fastigiafastigium, -i, n.: point rerum.
content.question: In line 1, regit is translated

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
